page.title: 14 STORTFORD FIRE STATION
page.content: The fire & ambulance station at Patmore Close,Hadham Road,was opened in 1970. There are 2 fire engines plus spare & support vehicles.12 full & 5 part-time officers are employed.There are 2 ambulances & 1 support vehicle for walking wounded.13 drivers & assistants are employed.Staff shortages are a problem.The area served includes the whole of Bishop's Stortford,westwards to the Hadhams & northwards to Braughing,Stocking & Furneux Pelham & even Saffron Walden.There are between 12 & 15 emergency calls per week,about 600 calls per year.Traffic congestion on the A1250 2 lane road which all vehicles have to use means increasing delays for both services.
